content: to be suitable for all sizes alternatively hook size and yarn can change the size of the gloves pattern make 2 gloves the same band note the band is crocheted vertically and when finished stitches are picked up from one edge to start on the main part of the glove it is done in blo except for the last and first stitch on one end this will make a neat edge on the end of the band r1 chain 13 17 from the second loop from the hook single_crochet to the end turn 12 16 r2 ch1 single_crochet in the blo to the last stitch 1 single_crochet through both loops turn 12 16 r3 ch1 1sc through both loops single_crochet in blo to the end turn 12 16 tip an easy way to remember which end has the scs through both loops is that it is the opposite end to the yarn tail r4- 38 42 repeat r2 and r3 the last round should finish at the edge where the single_crochet goes through both loops of the band fold short ends of band together remove hook and insert it in the first loop of the starting chain and grab and pull the yarn loop through this is the first stitch slip_stitch to the end by inserting the hook through one loop of the starting chain and flo of stitches from the last round when finished you can decide which side of the band you prefer especially around the join i turned mine inside out main glove r1 ch1 38 42 scs along the top edge of the band join 38 42 note you can do 2scs in between each ridge see pic it s helpful if you put a stitch marker in the first stitch here and throughout r2 ch1 1sc 1dc to end of round join 38 42 r3 ch2 1dc 1sc to end of round join 38 42 r4-r7 repeat r2 and r3 r8 repeat r2 r9 increase round ch1 1sc 1dc in the same stitch 1sc 1dc repeat to the last stitch 1sc 1dc in the same stitch join 40 44 r10 ch2 1dc 1sc to the end of round join 40 44 r11-14 repeat r2 and r3 thumb r1 ch1 1sc 1dc x 3 ch4 then skip the next 28 32 sts 1sc 1dc x 3 join 16 16 r2 chain 2 1dc 1sc x 3 1dc 1sc x 2 into the top loops of the chains from the previous round 1dc 1sc x 3 join 16 16 r3-r5 continue lp stitch for these 3 rounds cut yarn and finish off with either a slip_stitch or invisible finish there are many utube videos that demonstrate the invisible finish main glove cont d r15 join yarn to the first stitch after the thumb and continue along main section the thumb will be on the right ch1 1sc 1dc repeat to the beginning of the thumb note to avoid gaps
